string-array.item: ###Event notifications
#No notifications appear

The first step is to make sure that the setting \"Notification period\" has any period selected. After that try to select item \"Test notification\". If after all of the above, the notification still does not appear, then the matter is in the Android settings: either the \"Do not disturb\" mode is turned on, or all notifications are turned off in the notification manager, or the battery saving mode is turned on in the smartphone.
#Multiple notifications per event

Setting \"Notification period\" in the main application settings allows you to select several separate periods for notification of an event. For example, you can set up receiving notifications for the week and day of the event.
###Widgets
#Widget settings
To edit the settings of photo widget, click on event caption of the rightmost event. Clicking anywhere else in this event will open events list.
If no suitable events were found for the widget and the notification \"Events not found\" was displayed, then clicking on message will open this widget settings.
The on event click reaction may be configured in \"Settings-> Widgets (common settings)-> On click action\"
#Events don\'t fit or photos are too narrow
Go to the widget settings and try to modify \"Custom events number\" setting.
#Widgets are not updating

You must disable battery optimization for the application. There are different settings for different Android shells:
  • for Xiaomi MIUI this is \"Enable Autostart\" (Security–> Permissions–> Autostart)
  • for pure Android 9-11 this is \"Disable Battery optimization\" (Apps and notifications-> Advanced-> Special app access-> Battery optimization)
  • for Huawei EMUI this is \"Enable Autostart\" (Settings-> Battery-> Start applications)

When battery optimization is enabled, there will be a warning message at the top of the screen in each widget preference screen. A similar inscription will be at the bottom of the application settings. To turn off optimization, click on the red label

Sometimes on Android 9-10 widgets stop updating after installing a new version of the app. To fix widget updates you need to:
  1. remove the widget from the screen
  2. clear the launcher cache (in Android settings in the list of applications find the launcher and select \"clear cache\" in properties)
  3. restart the smartphone
  4. re-add the widget to the screen
If the standard widget update mechanism does not work, you can turn on the forced update interval: Settings-> Widgets-> Update interval.
###Events
#Contact events
By default, events (birthdays, anniversaries, user events, other events) from all accounts on the device are shown.
To restrict the choice of accounts for scanning events, it need to select the necessary ones in Settings-> Accounts.
To display events from all accounts (including local ones) click \"All\".
#<a id=\"events_calendar\">Calendar events

Any events from selected calendars are supported. Calendar sets are specified separately for the events \"Birthday\" and \"Other event\". The mechanism for working with calendar events differs depending on the type of event.

Birthday: During importing of event there is a search for a contact in the address book. Name recognition rules are used for this (by default uses calendar event title as contact name). If a contact is found, the person\'s data is used for event display. There are three options:
  1. contact found, but there is already data about the birthday - the date from the calendar will be added to the event (with or without a year - depending on the setting)
  2. the contact was found, but there is no information about the birthday - a new event will be added to the list
  3. contact not found - a new event will be added
Other event: these calendar events are not shown on the widgets, only in the event list and notifications. The entire event title will be used as event naming

How to setup the display of events:
  1. In the standard calendar application, create a calendar (or choose to display the calendar for national or religious holidays)
  2. If the calendar is empty, create or import the required events. Events must be for the whole day
  3. A link to instructions on how to upload friends\' birthdays from social networks is below
  4. If in a birthday calendar event, the contact name occupies only part of the event name, you can define rules for name retrieval. This name will be used to search for contacts in the address book to add additional attributes: photo, organization, title, alias. Rules are configured in Settings-> Events customizing-> Birthday-> Rules. For example: calendar event title \"Birthday. John Doe\", rule: \"Birthday. [name]\" (without quotes)
  5. After creating (enabling) calendars, you must select them in Settings-> Event customizing-> Birthday-> Calendars (Settings-> Event customizing-> Other event-> Calendars)
#<a id=\"events_files\">Events from local files

Events and birthdays from DarkBirthday Widget are supported with some features:
  • event date can be of any format without spaces (DD.MM.YYYY, MM/DD/YYYY etc)
  • if the year is unknown set 0000
  • the file must be saved in UTF-8 encoding
  • if there are several pairs of brackets after the name, then if the pairs of brackets follow each other - the content inside the last pair will be moved to contacts job title, if one pair is inside the other - the content inside the outer brackets will be moved to contacts job title

Birthday. Format (in square brackets - optional parameters):

# COMMENT
<DATE>[,FLAGS] <NAME LASTNAME> [([ORGANIZATION,] TITLE)] [WEB LINK]

Other event. Format (in square brackets - optional parameters):

# COMMENT
<DATE>[,FLAGS] <EVENT TITLE> [WEB LINK]

FLAGS:
1 - single event, which must be shown only once (year is required)
BC - Before the Common Era date (year is required!)

How to setup the display of events:
  1. Download or create files with events
  2. Select files in Settings-> Event customizing-> Birthday-> Files-> SELECT (Settings-> Event customizing-> Other event-> Files-> SELECT)
#Importing events from social networks
Facebook friends\' birthdays can be exported to calendar using the fb2cal tool: link, video instructions
###Common
#Search

To search for multiple parameters, separate them with commas (any value) or \"+\" (all values), for example:
  • \"John, Mary\"- will display contact events with the names John or Mary
  • \"John+Gemini\"- will display contact events with the name John and the zodiac sign Gemini
The search use all event data (to check: enable \"Extra features\" in common settings, long press on event in main list, item \"Event data\").
